content:
*Utterance*

Digital banking (online and mobile banking) makes managing finances easy. With digital banking technology, you can pay bills, deposit checks and transfer money from wherever you’re located. Due largely to their convenience, online and mobile banking are the two most popular ways to bank. More than three-quarters of Americans (78%) prefer to bank digitally, according to a March 2022 Ipsos-Forbes Advisor survey.
But how secure are online and mobile banking? And is your information safe?
While reputable financial institutions implement a slew of security measures, you can take some steps on your own to keep your financial and personal details out of the hands of hackers.

Is Online Banking Safe?
Online banking is a safe way to manage your money when your bank follows strict security protocols and you’re aware of how to spot potential security threats.
Banks utilize various security measures to protect customer information. Those measures can include:
• 128-bit or 256-bit data encryption
• Encrypted email messaging
• Automatic logout functionality for online and mobile banking
• Two-factor authentication
• Continuous account monitoring
• Electronic signature verification

How do I change my password in my online bank or app?
Here are two ways to change your password:
 From your web browser:
	1. Sign in to your online bank.
	2. Click on the profile icon in the top right.
	3. Under My Sign-in ID, click Edit next to your current password.
	4. Follow the instructions.
From your National Bank app:
	1. Sign in to the National Bank app.
	2. Expand the main menu and click on your name (Profile and preferences) and select Sign-in ID and security.
	3. UnderSign-in ID and security, click Pasword and follow the instructions.
 
You’ll receive a verification code the next time you sign in, even if you’ve selected the “Remember me” box.

*Instructions*
You'll be provided with a list of intents. Each intent has its Ids consisting of  2 numbers, 1 upper case letter, 2 lower case letters, 1 uppercase letter, 3 lower case letters and 2 numbers. It may also include a field "possible_values" which means the slot must match one of the provided values.

Your task is to go through the content of the utterance and assign the intent from the list that it matches the best.  Do not extract any slots and their values.
Your response should be only in json format! include key "output" in your response.

*List of intents*:
01WitCash01:  a customer wants withdraw cash from their account at the bank.
possible_values:
	1. Daily withdraw limit: $300
	2. Methods: ATM transactions, Branch Visit.
	3. Denominations: 20 or 50
02TraFund02: a customer wants transfer funds between their accounts at different banks or financial institutions.
03DepCash03:  a customer wants to deposit cash or a check into their account at the bank.
04CheBala04:  a customer wants to check the balance of their account at the bank.
possible_values: ATM, Online Banking, Mobile Banking App, Text banking, bank statement
05ChgPass05: a customer requests to change their online banking password.
